alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:13PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Floyd and northwestern Pike Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Blue Moon to Craynor to near Galveston. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Shelbiana around 425 PM EDT. Osborn, Harold, Betsy Layne, Chloe, Justell, Aluba and Boldman around 430 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Pikeville, Raccoon, Coal Run, Coal Run Village, Zebulon, Kimper and Meta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential downpours are also occurring with this storm and may lead to ponding of water on roadways or localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
